p: The Artemisia herba-alba extracts were examined against a series of highly pathogenic microorganisms. In this study, four human pathogenic bacteria were selected to screen their in-vitro antimicrobial activities. All four microbial strains were obtained from the stock culture of our laboratory. Both Gram-positive strains, including Bacillus cereus (ATCC 14579), Staphylococcus aureus (ATCC 6538), and Gram-negative strains, including Escherichia coli (ATCC 8739) and Proteus vulgaris (ATCC 7829), were tested in this study, as these are the most common food borne pathogens of concern. Bead vials were used to safely store microorganisms in frozen condition (−18 °C).
